abstract: Federal health officials, faced with advance of Zika virus, are split over whether to advise American women in virus-ridden areas to delay pregnancy; some infectious disease experts contend avoiding pregnancy is only way to prevent births of deformed infants, but others say women should have right to free choice.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Zika Experts  Divide on Advice for Pregnancies
headline.main: Health Officials Split Over Advice on Pregnancy in Zika Areas

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Some experts say avoiding conception is the only sure way to prevent deformed babies; others say the government should not tell women what to do with their bodies.
lead_paragraph: Some experts say avoiding conception is the only sure way to prevent deformed babies; others say the government should not tell women what to do with their bodies.
